definitions.definition: ( intransitive , originally US , often imperative ) To leave in a hurry ; to go away . [from early 20th c.]
examples: What are you kids doing on my lawn? Scram !

main_definition: ( intransitive , originally US , often imperative ) To leave in a hurry ; to go away . [from early 20th c.]

definitions.definition: ( transitive ) To shut down (a nuclear reactor or, by extension , some other thing ) for safety reasons , usually because of an emergency .
( intransitive ) Of a nuclear reactor or some other thing: to shut down, usually because of an emergency.

main_definition: ( transitive ) To shut down (a nuclear reactor or, by extension , some other thing ) for safety reasons , usually because of an emergency .
secondary_definitions: ( intransitive ) Of a nuclear reactor or some other thing: to shut down, usually because of an emergency.

definitions.definition: ( transitive , Derbyshire , Wales ) To scratch (something) with claws or fingernails ; to claw .
( transitive , US , mining , archaic ) To mine for ore on a small scale , especially from mines previously been worked on where most of the ore is believed to have been removed .

main_definition: ( transitive , Derbyshire , Wales ) To scratch (something) with claws or fingernails ; to claw .
secondary_definitions: ( transitive , US , mining , archaic ) To mine for ore on a small scale , especially from mines previously been worked on where most of the ore is believed to have been removed .

definitions.definition: Of one's body or limbs : to become numb or stiff due to cold , lack of movement , etc.
To be weakened by an accident , a disease , starvation , etc.

main_definition: Of one's body or limbs : to become numb or stiff due to cold , lack of movement , etc.
secondary_definitions: To be weakened by an accident , a disease , starvation , etc.
